intro: Aizodraba aizoides, commonly known as the Aizoides daisy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to southern Africa, this plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky soils. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
